question: In banking language, which among the following is called Contingent Liability of the banks?
explanation: In Non-fund based lending, bank does not make any funds outlay but only gives assurance. The “letter of credit” and “bank guarantees” fall into the category of non-funding loans. The non-funding loan can be converted to a fund-based advance if the client fails to fulfil the term of contract with the counterparty. In banking language, the non-funding advances are called Contingent Liability of the banks. http://www.gktoday.in/reference/types-of-loans-in-india/
